full_text:
Here's how every NFL team's offense has performed on scripted (x-axis) & non-scripted plays (y-axis) so far in 2022

#nflverse https://t.co/IjQ82r3P6W

From 1999 to 2021, teams that had a 4th quarter lead of more than 14 points were 2618-33-3 (0.987)

In the first two weeks of 2022, those teams are 14-3-1 (0.806)

Data: #nflverse

The Browns collapsed against the Jets on Sunday, giving up a 13-point lead in the last two minutes. They have now given up three of the four latest >10-point leads since 1999.

Here is every team that has blown a >10-point lead in the final four mins since 1999.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/APjOCTLWtx

This Sunday we had 3 of top-20 biggest turnarounds in Win Probability in 2nd half since 2006!
For sure, Jets - Browns game is the new top-1!

#nflverse #NFL https://t.co/rjkhoXCYwo

Here is a look at Ravens snaps from Week 1 by personnel. #nflverse
Special thanks to @reinhardNFL for help!
Extremely heavy personnel for Ravens. https://t.co/9AnHVUghA4

In week 1, Ravens continued to zig while the rest of the NFL zags. 
They came out in 11 personnel only 5 times (9% - NFL low), but passed on neutral downs 68% of the time (NFL high).
#NFLVerse #RavensFlock https://t.co/Nr3csWV0ww

bad play rate and explosive play rate for offenses for offenses in week 1

#nflverse https://t.co/7tIuUTMcKY

Through one week, #AFCNorth QBs struggled with accuracy (see negative values for CPOE on x-axis). Lamar, however, notably stood out with EPA per play due to positive plays both through the air and value added on the ground. #Steelers #nflverse https://t.co/3eR5GAdOqR
Highly suggest those in the #nflverse to check out the Next Gen Stats broadcast tonight. Higher angle feels like you are watching All 22. #TNF #NFL

WARNING: Pro Joe Burrow analytics tweet.

Which QBs performed better against the blitz vs drop 8 coverage last season (R = -0.16)?

#nflfastR #nflverse https://t.co/NbG4MO3rc3
@tejfbanalytics It's all #nflverse stuff!

With Week 1 of the #NFL season done and dusted, here's how teams performed relative to where they left off last season.

Let the overreactions begin!

#nflverse https://t.co/8RY3CKyCkE

This plot is still a work in progress, but here's a quick glance at each team's drives during #TNFonPrime.

Chargers did well to only hold the Chiefs to two TD drives, but that 99-yard pick-six hurts.

#nflverse #NFLTwitter https://t.co/xZTX50zRdQ

Inspired by one of my most favorite @FiveThirtyEight analyses (can't find it, but assuming it was @skepticalsports a few years ago), I recreated the analysis that shows that week one DOES have predictive power, along with every other record a team might have #nflverse #rstats https://t.co/Z989qVWm5j

We're through the opening week of the #nfl season, and my model has made its updates!  Things haven't change that much - the @BuffaloBills and @Chiefs remain the cream of the NFL crop.  But in 10,000 universes, who knows what can happen? #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/CQGIZkn465
That's the update for this week - hope you enjoy, and stay tuned for additional @nfl analyses and takeaways over the coming weeks.  #nflverse

All my Chiefs fans, got something new for you today! Here's a snap count breakdown based on personnel formations. Some interesting notes: Gray is first TE when its 2 TE sets. Hardman is the WR when there's only 1 WR on the field. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/5s0ZHL2ROU

On defense, we ran with 5 or more DB's on the field all but two snaps. A TON of different mixes in DL when there were just 3 DL on the field. I think Cook is pretty much our #3 safety. In every case where there were 3 CB, 3 S, it was him over Bush.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/9zaWlwdCaj

Here's Arizona's numbers as well, for comparative purposes. Dear lord, did they send out a ton of different defensive alignments...

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/D9pirFv9CW

In the span of one hour yesterday, there were *ten* game-winning or game-tying kicks attempted. This is the most kicks of this kind in a one-hour span in at least 20 years.

5 makes, 5 misses

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/P6sKUZNKn7

Something new that will hopefully be helpful for fantasy folks!

There is a dot on this graph for every RB snap in Week 1. Dots further to the left are in running situations, dots further to the right are in passing situations.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/369rCZL0Mk

How much did each team's top six draft picks play this week?

Also includes some notes about special teamers!

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/LS01z7zm77

I feel like @_TanHo, @benbbaldwin, @mrcaseb all need some massive shoutouts and thanks. 

I see them constantly interacting with people and answering questions in the #nflverse discord WHILE solving all of the problems the NFL keeps creating. 

Thank y’all!

ICYMI: Josh had really nice things to say about using ffopportunity for studying backfield usage!

I'd personally describe it as (to my knowledge) the first fully public expected fantasy points model trained on public #nflverse data - and it obviously can be used for much more! https://t.co/wFbTBmvSwD

Here's how every NFL team's offense has performed on scripted (x-axis) & non-scripted plays (y-axis) so far in 2022

#nflverse https://t.co/IjQ82r3P6W

For sure, Jets - Browns game is the new top-1!

Highly suggest those in the #nflverse to check out the Next Gen Stats broadcast tonight. Higher angle feels like you are watching All 22. #TNF #NFL

Here is a look at Ravens snaps from Week 1 by personnel. #nflverse
Special thanks to @reinhardNFL for help!
Extremely heavy personnel for Ravens. https://t.co/9AnHVUghA4

In week 1, Ravens continued to zig while the rest of the NFL zags. 
They came out in 11 personnel only 5 times (9% - NFL low), but passed on neutral downs 68% of the time (NFL high).
#NFLVerse #RavensFlock https://t.co/Nr3csWV0ww

bad play rate and explosive play rate for offenses for offenses in week 1

#nflverse https://t.co/7tIuUTMcKY

Through one week, #AFCNorth QBs struggled with accuracy (see negative values for CPOE on x-axis). Lamar, however, notably stood out with EPA per play due to positive plays both through the air and value added on the ground. #Steelers #nflverse https://t.co/3eR5GAdOqR
Highly suggest those in the #nflverse to check out the Next Gen Stats broadcast tonight. Higher angle feels like you are watching All 22. #TNF #NFL

With Week 1 of the #NFL season done and dusted, here's how teams performed relative to where they left off last season.

Let the overreactions begin!

#nflverse https://t.co/8RY3CKyCkE

This plot is still a work in progress, but here's a quick glance at each team's drives during #TNFonPrime.

Chargers did well to only hold the Chiefs to two TD drives, but that 99-yard pick-six hurts.

#nflverse #NFLTwitter https://t.co/xZTX50zRdQ

Inspired by one of my most favorite @FiveThirtyEight analyses (can't find it, but assuming it was @skepticalsports a few years ago), I recreated the analysis that shows that week one DOES have predictive power, along with every other record a team might have #nflverse #rstats https://t.co/Z989qVWm5j

We're through the opening week of the #nfl season, and my model has made its updates!  Things haven't change that much - the @BuffaloBills and @Chiefs remain the cream of the NFL crop.  But in 10,000 universes, who knows what can happen? #nflverse #RStats https://t.co/CQGIZkn465
That's the update for this week - hope you enjoy, and stay tuned for additional @nfl analyses and takeaways over the coming weeks.  #nflverse

All my Chiefs fans, got something new for you today! Here's a snap count breakdown based on personnel formations. Some interesting notes: Gray is first TE when its 2 TE sets. Hardman is the WR when there's only 1 WR on the field. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/5s0ZHL2ROU

On defense, we ran with 5 or more DB's on the field all but two snaps. A TON of different mixes in DL when there were just 3 DL on the field. I think Cook is pretty much our #3 safety. In every case where there were 3 CB, 3 S, it was him over Bush.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/9zaWlwdCaj

Here's Arizona's numbers as well, for comparative purposes. Dear lord, did they send out a ton of different defensive alignments...

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/D9pirFv9CW

In the span of one hour yesterday, there were *ten* game-winning or game-tying kicks attempted. This is the most kicks of this kind in a one-hour span in at least 20 years.

5 makes, 5 misses

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/P6sKUZNKn7
